descript.abstract: The Annonaceae are one of the largest tropical plant families (about 2300 species) with a worldwide distribution. A number of these species is of economic importance (fruits, perfumes and ornamental purposes). This CD-ROM holds a fully up-to-date information system with an overview of all known genera (121) of the Annonaceae and was composed by an international network of specialists. New concise descriptions and additional information are accompanied by detailed line drawings, photos and color slides, and distribution maps. Identification of the genera is facilitated by two types of computer assisted keys: a dichotomous key and an innovative multi-access key. An interactive geographic information system presents distribution data and supports geographic searches and comparisons. A literature database with over 4800 references and a hyperlinked illustrated glossary of terms with more then 300 illustrations are part of the system.
descript.purpose: This CD-ROM is a taxonomic reference work for researchers of various disciplines such as plant taxonomists, curators of plant collections, ecologists, foresters, ethnobotanists, pharmacologists, teachers and nature conservators and managers.
descript.supplinf: This information was obtained from the ETI web site - http://www.eti.uva.nl/Products/CD-catalogue.html. (previous geoform was 'CD-ROM database')

cntinfo.cntinst: info@eti.uva.nl - general information about ETI. Phone and fax numbers are for general information. Email adress webmaster@eti.uva.nl may know the most about the online World Biodiversity database.

dataqual.complete: This CD-ROM holds a fully up-to-date information system with an overview of all known genera (121) of the Annonaceae and was composed by an international network of specialists.

overview.eaover: Entity - Neotropical plant families; descriptions, line drawings, photos and full color slides of plants, flower, fruit and seed and geographical distributions.

distinfo.distliab: ETI is committed to updating its CD-ROM publications in the above mentioned series, including adapting them to hardware configurations and computer operating systems to come (meaning that they will be replaced by new versions when big changes occur). All users of ETI CD-ROM products and the Linnaeus II software can ask for support at our by a helpdesk [support@eti.uva.nl]. We will do our very best to help you with any questions that may arise.

stdorder.ordering: The Copepods CD-ROM can be ordered at your local bookshop, and the following distributor(s): Springer Customer Service, Haberstrasse 7, 69126 Heidelberg, Germany; fax: +49 (0) 6221/345 229; e-mail: orders@springer.de; UNESCO Publishing, 7, place de Fontenoy, 75352 Paris 07 SP, France. ETI-partners may order directly at ETI as they receive a discount on the retail prices of all CD's. The Linnaeus II software for Biodiversity Documentation can be purchased only at ETI.

distinfo.techpreq: Windows: Windows 95/98, Pentium CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher. Macintosh: System 7.x/8.x, 680x0/PowerPC CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher.
